name: Curry House Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the The Curry House on Fleming Street for 8 days in July 2010. It was one of the most relaxing and fun trips we've ever taken. The staff at the B and B, Darlene and Lois, not only cooked wonderful, full breakfasts every morning, but they gave us great suggestions for activities and were always available to answer our questions; they took care of us as if we were family! I had never stayed in a B and B before, but now I'm spoiled and will go back to The Curry House every time I visit Key West. In addition, we hung around the house in the pool quite a bit--it was sweltering while we were there--and I witnessed the ladies cleaning the rooms constantly. Everything about our room was perfect; it was well appointed, with a very comfortable bed and exceptionally clean bathroom. I also checked out most of the other rooms in the house and would gladly stay in any of them.
reviews.title: The Curry House is fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at the Curry House B&B for the first time and definitely would go back again. It has to have one of the largest and nicest pools of any B&B in Key West. Great for lounging around in the afternoon and a full breakfast is served poolside each morning. The hosts are helpful and attentive. The building is very clean. Rooms size about average for KW. Bathroom a shade on the small side. But considering the rate it is a great value in the heart of Old Towne where you can walk to everything.
reviews.title: Nice pool and a full breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had read the many nice reviews about the Curry House and were looking forward to staying there. Our room was very small. There was a noisey, but effective, window aircondition. There was no fan in the bathroom, and no closet for your clothes, just a small rack in one corner of the room. There was a lovely deck outside the room overlooking a very nice pool. The house did not appear to be airconditioned except for the rooms. For breakfast you had a choice of cold cereal or hot breakfast . We would have loved to see fresh fruit and yougurt. The staff was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: A Little Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great choice of B&B in Key West. It is in a very convienent location, just a few blocks off of Duval Street, close to the Gulf Coast, a supermarket right down the road. It is very clean and quiet, the breakfast was very nice, the pool is kept pretty warm (that could be good or bad depending on your preference) a/c in each room, very nice and helpful staff. Make sure you check out on their website which room you want to stay in, each is slightly different with some not as good as others. Our room was a bit small but enough space for just us. The semi-private balcony is a balcony on the back of the house that the room has a private door to but you are only separated from your neighbor by a large plant, so if they were using the balcony at the same time it would not be private. The shower has great pressure. The shampoo and conditioner they give smells like cologne so I suggest bringing your own. The matteress was a little worn out and the pillows weren't great. Overall it was really clean (though they do not change the sheets each night) the pool is small but kept very nice, the breakfast is tastey, the house is very nice, and it is an ideal location. I would recommend it and stay there again. Key West is beautiful, has an exciting night life, lots of water sports, and many quiet lovely streets.
reviews.title: Great stay in Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Curry House was our first experience at a Bed & Breakfast. We were lucky to have tripped over this beautiful property by accident. What a lucky find ! The people were so pleasant and friendly; the location was ideal; the complimentary breakfast was done up so beautifully; we stayed over Easter weekend and even the napkins were Easter decor; the owner even stayed up late the night before to decorate the eating area; which was poolside, and both mornings, to exquisite music by Enya ! This place was made to order; from top to bottom. It I could rate this a "ten", I'd go further and rate it an "eleven" ! I highly recommend it and my husband and I are contemplating another visit in late September. These people KNOW what they are doing to please their guests. Thank you Sue and husband (who, I think, was the cook each morning). You made our stay and our anniversary top notch ! Thank you, Thank you, Thank you !
reviews.title: The Best 2nd Honeymoon Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about this Bed and Breakfast was great. The room we stayed in was comfortable and clean. The breakfasts were delicious and plentiful. The location is great. The hosts were very nice. Wonderful place to stay in Key West.
reviews.title: Great Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time staying at the Curry House and my husband and I found it to be extremely comfortable. The location couldn't be beat for what we like to do. We were right around the corner from Eaton Bikes and only a few blocks from Pepe's, Turtle Kraals, and Schooner Wharf. Another thing that we enjoyed was that the pool area was very comfortable. As a matter of fact we spent two days lounging by the pool, something we don't normally do. Lois was the perfect innkeeper, around when you needed her and helpful with any questions that we might have had. I would definitely stay at Curry House again.
reviews.title: Love the Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Curry House and my husband and I love this place. We have been traveling to Key west for years and have always tried staying in a different place until we stayed at the curry house. This place has everything you could want or need in a place to stay. Key West charm, clean, comfortable rooms, great location, great value, pool and breakfast in the morning. The place is small enough that sometimes you feel like you have the place to yourself! It is close to both the wharf area/marinas and Duval Street, so you can walk or ride a bike anywhere but it is far enough away so it is also very quiet and private when you want to get away from all the noise on Duval. There is limited parking but in KW you don't need a car but if you happen to drive down there is parking on the street or side streets. Usually you can find a place and just leave the car where it is.
reviews.title: Great Place, Love the Curry House!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Along with the Curry House being great so is Lois the Inn Keeper. Allways there when you need her and helpful if you need anything.
reviews.title: Charming & Cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From someone who knows KW, if you want a good value and nice place to stay do yourself a favor and stay at the Curry House!
reviews.title: Great location B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is a nice old house...beautiful street...makes for a relaxing place to stay. Special notice to James of the staff for being so very kind and funny. Its a short walk to Duval...and if you want to explore off Duval....its close to 5 Brother coffee and also Finnegan's Wake. Curry House serves a full hot and good breakfast..to get you started.
reviews.title: Relaxing and enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at Curry House, we were their for 3 days. We stayed in room number 9, which we had been warned had a small ceiling. This is true. If you are over 5'6" you'd better not get this room. But for us being under this height it worked out just right. For the price we paid we were very pleased with the Curry House. We will stay their again when we return to the Key West.
reviews.title: Very Quiet and Relaxing Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: the curry house was absolutely wonderful. We found it very central for all the activities in key west. very helpful and friendly staff . Plenty of real english tea.Would definitely reccommend to our friends Hope to one day make a return visit
reviews.title: this was by far the best in key west.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: m.collins m.collins v.leek m.leek
reviews.title: Great warm relaxing Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Curry House is a great place to stay. My husband and I stayed several days and really relaxed and enjoyed ourselves. They have a fantastic full breakfast every morning. Each morning was something homemade and special. The owners are very warm fun loving people that you will enjoy. They make you feel like you are at home. I love the old town Key West homes. Very convenient to Duvall but quiet to enjoy peacefulness. Everything was clean and well maintained. We will be back again.
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B Hospitality...Felt like I was staying with family...A++++++

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at Curry House B&B. The staff was amazingly helpful with tips on where to go and getting us cabs to the airport. The room was clean and a nice size for us choosing the smallest room in B&B. The location is also very nice, only about three blocks from duvall st. The place was quiet at night but you were very close to night life. I would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Great Staff...great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took the ferry from Fort Myers and were able to walk from the ferry dock to this b & b, down quiet residential streets. We were pleased with the location close to a number of good restaurants including Cafe Sole and Pepe's as well as the Harbour Walk. We choose Room 7 on the third floor with a nice view on a semi-private balcony. The bathroom was small but adequate and the king size bed was comfortable.
reviews.title: Good location for exploring Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at The Curry House twice and I love it there. A great location just a few blocks from Duval, and also very close to the boardwalk and the marina.
reviews.title: Favorite B and B in KW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are also two great restaurants in the same neighborhood, Michael's and Mangia, Mangia. Two of my favorite restaurants, Pepe's and BO's Fish Wagon are also close by on Caroline street.
reviews.title: Perfect Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great pool area with wine tastings and an amazing breakfast.
reviews.title: a nice experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here with two older children and throughly enjoyed the peace and quiet yet just a short walk to lively Duval Streetand the Square.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Charming accommodation with a small pool to cool down in. I would definitely return.
reviews.title: Great Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: My husband took me to Key West for teh first time the beginning of June and we stayed at The Curry House. I AM SO HAPPY WE DID! Lois was a great "host". She answered all our questions over the phone when we called numberous times and when we arrived. We were able to check in early on Friday so that we could go explore the island. The Curry House is close to EVEYTHING (within walking/riding distance) without actually being on noisy Duval Street. We parked our car and didn't move it the entire weekend.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place in Old Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lois was informative. I remember she called us on one of our outings to give us more ideas on where to go and what to see.
reviews.title: Great location - not so great room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: We stayed in what I like to call the "Parrot Room" on the second floor right next to the shared bathroom. Initally I was worried about sharing the bathroom with other guest, but there were no issues. Bathroom was always avaliable and very clean.
reviews.title: So cozy. Great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you, Curry House, for a really pleasant stay. The best part; coming back from an evening out and relaxing in your lovely pool before a shower and to bed.
reviews.title: Yes,the bathroom is small. SO WHAT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The veranda, breakfast at poolside, our clean, quiet, relaxing room and gracious staff make this one of our best-ever lodging choices!
reviews.title: You can't do any better than this in Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My wife and I had a great time at Curry House this week. You know when you stay somewhere and it feels like "your" home that Curry House must be doing something very right. The house and our room were just delightful. So convenient to both the ferry and downtown. The hot breakfasts each morning were wonderful, an added benefit that many may not realize how valuable. Easily $10 apiece at a restaurant. A lot of helpful Key West info and coupons at our fingertips in the living room. And the pool. So cozy. The water temp just right to cool you off just a bit. And ice, plenty of ice, for our drinks in the evening. A grocery store 2 blocks away. Mangia Mangia right around the corner - a very good and reasonable Italian restaurant for dinner. And such a friendly and accomodating staff added to our enjoyment. They even allowed us to stay late and relax by the pool while we awaited our evening ferry.
reviews.title: Fantabulous getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009
reviews.text: Spent the weekend at the Curry House. The staff was very accomodating and friendly! Not far from Duval Street - walking distance to most places. We had no need to move the car once we got there. Groceries, coffee, restaurants, entertainment all within walking distance.
reviews.title: Exceptional Hospitality!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely return to the Curry House!!!!
reviews.title: Cute Place, Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our second trip to Key West, I refused to entertain the idea of any other Bed and Breakfast or Guesthouse. I'm sure there are many wonderful places to stay in KW, but I'll always go to The Curry House! My husband and I were there in March 2012 for a friend's wedding, and yet again, Lois treated us as her own family. Unfortunately, this trip was only two days, but I'll be back as soon as possible. The breakfast is spectacular, the rooms are comfortable and clean, and the location is fantastic.
reviews.title: Fantastic . . . AGAIN!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at Curry Inn B&B and will definitely stay again should we visit in the future. We were very pleased with room #7 which had a king bed, semi-private balcony overlooking the pool, and private bath. It was very clean, quaint and warm. We felt more at home than we ever have with any hotel stay. Lois was a pleasure to chat with and she was a great resource for travel information. She recommended places to eat and visit and all of her tips came in handy. We especially enjoyed the fresh, hot breakfast each morning as well. It was such a treat that we made sure we awoke in time to dine each morning. My husband is a beverage drinker and asked for additional juice the first morning we ate there. Both the owner and Lois remembered this and voluntarily offered him additional juice to be kept at our table each morning that followed . That was very sweet and excellent service on their part. The price per night was way below other B&B in the area...we couldn't have made a better choice.
reviews.title: Lovely Key West Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: On many trips to our home away from home..we just found curry house. Small and intimate ( 9 rooms)..each carefully decorated..ours was #7..had a semi private porch..slept with doors open...like alot of old conch houses, it has some bumps..tiny bathroom...tiny tv..but the service was impecable..the breakfast..made by the owners..was a lovely surprise...the price was well below the going rates...and the bed was comfy and the pool was heated..5 short blocks from the madness..a lovely quiet part of old town
reviews.title: A quiet home not to far from duval

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Curry House surprised us with a really nice and rather big room. The balcony behind the house was relaxing pure, very quiet on that side. Duval Street and Mallory Square are only a short walk away. The included breakfast is homemade each day and is a perfect start into the day Parking is free outside the house although it coudl be a little tricky to find a free spot on busy days.
reviews.title: Perfect Location and worth the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights and we will be back again. The location is awesome 3 blocks from Duval. We were welcomed by Lois who was so NICE. they are all nice anyway. This place is so charming and it is exactly the type of house you want to be in Key west. It is clean, the rooms are big with bathroom, closet, balcony if you are on the 2nd or 3 rd floor it is so romantic. There is a heated pool where you can take a great HOMEMADE breakfast served every morning made by the adorable couple, owners of the curry house.
reviews.title: CONVENIENT LOCATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the inn for a long weekend over the end of January into February. We booked Room 9 and were prepared for the low ceilings, it was an adventure and amusing at times, but no complaints. Next time we will definitely spend a wee bit more and do a regular room though.
reviews.title: Great value & great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is fantastic. It is very close to many of our favorite spots. The pool is just the right size and provides a great place to relax during the day. Breakfast was a wonderful treat, much more than we are used to at other Key West Inns/B&B's. We have been visiting Key West for over 10 years and this was our first stay at Curry House, we will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Good location, well run, comfortable and quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I chose to try the Curry House because of its location, features, reviews, availability and value. It exceeded my expectations. The famous Duval Street or the Historic Seaport are three blocks away, close enough to walk and far enough for peace and quiet. I counted twenty popular restaurants within three to four blocks of the Curry House. An inn with nine rooms, each has a small refrigerator and a TV, a window air conditioner and other amenities listed on their web site. A hot breakfast such as scrambled eggs and biscuits with gravy, or French toast or pancakes with sausage, was served daily 8:30 to 9:30AM. The outdoor eating area where breakfast is served is under an awning and overlooks the heated pool. A microwave and an ice chest at the wet bar make it convenient for guests to eat their own food there later in the day. I used it for restaurant meal leftovers. The staff was courteous and helpful, anticipating our needs.
reviews.title: What a wonderful charming place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in #6 on the ground floor with a king-size bed. The compact stall shower delivered torrents of hot water on demand. I ran the air conditioner while away and usually used only the ceiling fan when in the room. The clock radio had really big numbers, so I could read the time from across the room in the dark. The room was quiet at night. The only exception was briefly at 5AM and 6AM Monday when the trash truck went by. We found the room comfortable and enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience...excellent breakfast...friendly staff...great value-great rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I made my reservations, I found that I could not use my usual on-line travel sites. Instead, the Curry House web site has the various room descriptions and rate schedules and a link to a calendar that may show which days have vacancies. Finally, an e-mail, ‘phone call or on-line reservation request determines which rooms are available.
reviews.title: Best B&B to enjoy Key West

description: Classic Old Town home built by ship builders on Green Turtle Cay in the Bahamas, shipped to Key West, and assembled in 1889! Perfect location - 3 blocks from Duval Street and 3 blocks from the Historic Seaport. Quiet, Romantic, Tropical. Nine delightful rooms. Complimentary HOT Country Breakfast and Happy Hour, (during peak season)! Heated pool open 24-hours! 8 rooms have direct access to verandas or wrap-around porches with secluded sitting areas. All rooms - refrigerators, cable television, telephone, and more! Come and enjoy a midwest welcome in paradise!
